objectives: Learn the names of common musical instruments.
Identify and name different professions and the work people do.
Use these words to talk about music and jobs.

sections.text: These are words for different instruments that people play to create music. Some are played by blowing, some by hitting, and some by using strings.

examples.label: Guitar
examples.value: A stringed instrument with a long neck, played by plucking or strumming the strings.

examples.label: Piano
examples.value: A large keyboard instrument with black and white keys that are pressed to make sound.

examples.label: Keyboard
examples.value: An electronic instrument similar to a piano but smaller and portable.

examples.label: Drums
examples.value: A set of percussion instruments, like drums and cymbals, hit with sticks to create rhythm.

examples.label: Flute (Bansuri)
examples.value: A wind instrument made from a tube with holes, played by blowing across a hole at one end.

examples.label: Violin
examples.value: A stringed instrument played with a bow, held under the chin.

examples.label: Trumpet
examples.value: A brass wind instrument with a flared bell, played by buzzing the lips into a mouthpiece.

examples.label: Sitar
examples.value: A traditional Indian stringed instrument with a long neck and a gourd body.

examples.label: Tabla
examples.value: A pair of small hand drums from India, a main instrument in classical music.

examples.label: Harmonium
examples.value: A keyboard instrument where air is pumped through reeds with bellows.

examples.label: Dholak
examples.value: A traditional two-headed hand drum from India, often used in folk music.

examples.label: Veena
examples.value: A large, ancient Indian stringed instrument, important in Carnatic classical music.

examples.label: Shehnai
examples.value: A traditional Indian wind instrument, often played at weddings and auspicious occasions.

examples.label: Mridangam
examples.value: A barrel-shaped, two-headed drum from Southern India.

examples.label: Saxophone
examples.value: A curved, metal wind instrument used in jazz and classical music.

examples.label: Bell
examples.value: A cup-shaped metal instrument that makes a ringing sound when struck.

examples.label: Cymbals (Manjira)
examples.value: Two round metal plates that are struck together to make a ringing sound.

examples.label: Tambourine (Khanjari)
examples.value: A small drum with metal jingles around the edge, played by shaking or hitting.

examples.label: Xylophone
examples.value: An instrument with wooden bars of different lengths that are struck with mallets.

examples.label: Mouth Organ (Harmonica)
examples.value: A small rectangular wind instrument played by blowing and drawing air through reeds.

examples.label: Santoor
examples.value: An Indian stringed instrument with many strings, played by striking with small wooden mallets.

examples.label: Sarod
examples.value: A fretless stringed instrument used mainly in Indian classical music.

examples.label: Gong
examples.value: A large metal disc that is hit with a mallet to produce a deep sound.

examples.label: Conch (Shankh)
examples.value: A large seashell that is blown like a horn, used in religious ceremonies.

examples.label: Accordion
examples.value: A portable box-shaped instrument with a keyboard and bellows.

usage_examples: My brother is learning to play the guitar.
The musician played the piano beautifully.
The flute has a very sweet sound.
In the village procession, a man was playing the dholak with great energy.
The temple bell rings in the morning and evening.
She played a beautiful melody on her sitar.
The tabla player accompanied the singer.
A shehnai was being played at the wedding.
We heard the sound of a conch shell from the temple.
The band had a drummer, a guitarist, and a keyboard player.

sections.text: These are the names for the different jobs or work that people do to earn a living and help the community.

examples.label: Teacher
examples.value: A person who teaches students in a school.

examples.label: Doctor
examples.value: A person who treats sick people.

examples.label: Farmer
examples.value: A person who grows crops and raises animals on a farm.

examples.label: Engineer
examples.value: A person who designs and builds things like bridges, roads, and machines.

examples.label: Police Officer
examples.value: A person who maintains law and order and protects people.

examples.label: Soldier
examples.value: A person who serves in an army and protects the country.

examples.label: Driver
examples.value: A person who drives a vehicle like a bus, car, or truck.

examples.label: Shopkeeper
examples.value: A person who owns or manages a shop.

examples.label: Postman
examples.value: A person who delivers letters and parcels.

examples.label: Carpenter
examples.value: A person who makes and repairs wooden objects and furniture.

examples.label: Plumber
examples.value: A person who installs and repairs water pipes and taps.

examples.label: Electrician
examples.value: A person who installs and repairs electrical wiring.

examples.label: Mason
examples.value: A person who builds with bricks, stones, or cement.

examples.label: Mechanic
examples.value: A person who repairs machines, especially vehicles.

examples.label: Blacksmith
examples.value: A person who makes and repairs things made of iron.

examples.label: Goldsmith
examples.value: A person who makes and repairs jewelry from gold.

examples.label: Potter
examples.value: A person who makes pots and other items from clay.

examples.label: Weaver
examples.value: A person who weaves cloth from thread.

examples.label: Tailor
examples.value: A person who stitches and alters clothes.

examples.label: Lawyer
examples.value: A person who advises people about the law and represents them in court.

examples.label: Judge
examples.value: A person who decides cases in a court of law.

examples.label: Scientist
examples.value: A person who studies science and does research.

examples.label: Artist
examples.value: A person who creates art, like paintings or sculptures.

examples.label: Writer / Author
examples.value: A person who writes books, stories, or articles.

examples.label: Singer
examples.value: A person who sings songs.

examples.label: Dancer
examples.value: A person who dances professionally.

examples.label: Pilot
examples.value: A person who flies an airplane.

examples.label: Chef / Cook
examples.value: A person who prepares food, especially in a restaurant.

examples.label: Nurse
examples.value: A person who is trained to care for sick or injured people.

examples.label: Firefighter
examples.value: A person who puts out fires.

examples.label: Barber
examples.value: A person who cuts hair and shaves beards.

examples.label: Cobbler
examples.value: A person who mends shoes.

examples.label: Sweeper / Cleaner
examples.value: A person who cleans public places like streets and buildings.

usage_examples: The teacher explained the lesson to the students.
We go to a doctor when we are sick.
The farmer works hard in the fields all day.
The police officer caught the thief.
A soldier defends our country's borders.
The bus driver takes children to school.
The carpenter made a new table for our house.
We called a plumber to fix the leaking tap.
A mason is building the new school wall.
The mechanic repaired my father's motorcycle.
The potter sells beautiful clay pots at the village market.
My mother gave her sari to the tailor to be altered.
A scientist works in a laboratory.
The singer has a very melodious voice.
A pilot flies high in the sky.
The nurse gave the patient an injection.
My brother goes to the barber for a haircut.
The cobbler mended my broken sandal.
